cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (potential â€“ not yet hurricane strength)
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the central Louisiana coast, then forecast to arc northeast across Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia and into the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane: none.  Tropical-storm watch area not issued at this time.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL including Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, far western Florida Panhandle) with inland track across the southeastern United States
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: none listed for Mid-Atlantic; nearest in table is ATLANTA GA (>600 mi southwest)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at the port; breezy conditions possible early next week as remnant low passes well south/east.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Delaware River or Delaware Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring periods of rain (1-2 in.) early next week but flooding rains not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river level rises possible downstream from heavy rain over the Southeast, but no direct operational hazards anticipated at the port.
